title: Business Analist - Business Intelligence
description:
**Over deze vacature**  


Als Business Analist ben je een echte bruggenbouwer tussen de business, Business Intelligence en IT. Je zoekt de optimale mix tussen de wensen en belangen van de eindgebruiker en de mogelijkheden die techniek en architectuur bieden. Je doet dit in het Business Intelligence domein van Bedrijven (zakelijke schade verzekeringen). Je werkt binnen het DEVOPS team samen met BI-ontwikkelaars (Azure Synapse, SAP HANA/BW, Power BI) aan oplossingen voor de diverse business onderdelen, zoals Schaderegeling, Acceptatie, Finance, Product en Portfolio Management en Expertise en Risicodeskundigheid. Je bent een resultaatgerichte consultant met het doel om de business vooruit te brengen en snapt hoe technologie en data hierin een rol speelt.  

De werkzaamheden bestaan primair uit:
* Ophalen, begrijpen en vastleggen business wensen.
* Uitwerken van features en user story’s.
* Faciliteren MVP workshops en refinements.
* Adviseren van de business en IT, je denkt inhoudelijk mee over oplossingen.
**De afdeling**  

De afdeling Product- en Portfoliomanagement Schade Bedrijven bestaat uit productmanagers, data analisten, pricing analisten en data scientists en de collega’s uit het kennisteam BI, in totaal zo’n 60 collega’s. Deze professionals werken voor de merken Centraal Beheer, Interpolis en Avéro Achmea. Ze houden zich specifiek bezig met ontwikkelen, beheren en het rendement van zakelijke schadeverzekering. De grootste uitdaging voor de komende jaren zijn de datagedrevenheid binnen de keten te vergroten, de portefeuille te rationaliseren met daarbij de overstap naar doelarchitectuur en de grote IT transitie die daarmee gepaard gaat.

  

Wij werken via de Agile Scrum methode in multidisciplinaire teams. Elke kwartaal hebben we 2 PI dagen (1 dag in Apeldoorn en 1 dag in Tilburg) en we werken in sprints van 3 weken. We werken hybride en minimaal 1 dag per week op locatie (Tilburg of Apeldoorn). Het thuiswerken wordt bij Achmea maximaal ondersteund.

  

De Ontwikkelaar maakt deel uit van het Kennisteam BI Bedrijven.Je komt in een divers team van 11 collega’s met ontwikkelaars SAP BW on HANA of Azure, business analisten, een functioneel beheerder en tester. Wij zijn een gezellig team wat soms ook buiten werktijd vrijblijvend met elkaar afspreekt. Wij kijken ernaar uit om jou te verwelkomen! Je rapporteert aan de manager BI Kennisteam Schade Bedrijven. Het team maakt onderdeel uit van P&PM binnen Schade Bedrijven. Je werkt voor zowel de afdeling P&PM als de overige afdelingen binnen Schade Bedrijven.

**Jouw achtergrond**  

* Je bezit aantoonbaar hbo of wo werk- en denkniveau.
* Je werkt zelfstandig en zoekt waar nodig afstemming.
* Je bent een verbinder en snapt het grotere plaatje (de hele keten).
* Je bent ondernemend, besluitvaardig en neemt verantwoordelijkheid voor je werk.
* Je hebt een “agile mindset” en bij voorkeur ervaring met agile werken in een Scaled Agile (SAFe) omgeving.
* Je bent communicatief sterk en je voert je gesprekken op basis van inhoud en argumenten.
* Je bent analytisch sterk en gaat voor resultaat.
* Je bent secuur, vanwege het uitwerken van ontwerpen en mappings.
* Je hebt bij voorkeur kennis en ervaring opgedaan op één of meerdere IT afdelingen van Achmea of een andere verzekeraar.
* Je bent data driven en hebt sterke affiniteit met IT.
* Kennis en ervaring op het gebied van het BI domein is een pré.

  

Binnen Achmea stellen wij het klantbelang centraal. Dit betekent dat wij alleen producten en diensten aanbieden met toegevoegde waarde voor de klant op de lange termijn. Het is daarom belangrijk dat je in deze functie de belangen van de klant onderkent en zichtbaar afweegt ongeacht of je nu direct of indirect klantcontact hebt. Je geeft de klant wat hij/zij werkelijk nodig heeft.

**Wat krijg je van ons**  

  

Als medewerker bij Achmea zet jij je elke dag in voor een gezonde, veilige én duurzame toekomst. En daar belonen we je graag voor! Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons een goed salaris, een mooie pensioenregeling mét lage eigen bijdrage (3,25%), 136 verlofuren (op basis van 34 uur per week) én korting op onze verzekeringen.
  

Maar er is meer!

 **34-urige werkweek**  

Een 34-urige werkweek is bij Achmea de standaard! Je werkt dan bijvoorbeeld 4 dagen van 8,5 uur. Zo heb je nóg meer tijd voor vrijwilligerswerk, een goed boek, mantelzorg óf jouw favoriete sport!

 **All You Can Learn**  

Onder de noemer All You Can Learn volg je opleidingen, cursussen en trainingen. De wereld van leren en ontwikkelen ligt bij ons aan je voeten!  



  

**Klimaatbudget**  


Ben je langer dan 12 maanden in dienst? Dan krijg je €2.500 netto klimaatbudget (bij fulltime dienstverband) om je huis te verduurzamen, duurzaam witgoed te kopen óf bijvoorbeeld een elektrische fiets aan te schaffen. Dit bedrag is bedoeld voor producten en diensten die een bijdrage leveren aan verduurzaming en verbetering van het milieu. **Healthy initiatieven**  

Gezond werken vinden we belangrijk, dus zorgen we ook dat dit kan met een berg healthy initiatieven!  



  

**Persoonlijk keuzebudget**  

Je ontvangt maandelijks een persoonlijk keuzebudget, opgebouwd uit 8% vakantietoeslag, 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering en 3,85% bovenwettelijk verlof. Je kiest zelf op welk moment je dit budget laat uitbetalen, je het gebruikt voor verlofsparen of dat je er vakantie-uren van koopt.  



  

**Over Achmea**  

Achmea staat voor Duurzaam Samen Leven. Een inclusieve samenleving waarin iedereen meedoet en plezierig en gezond met en naast elkaar leeft, is ons ideaalbeeld. Op een manier die langdurig kan voortbestaan. Goede reden om beter met onze leefomgeving om te gaan en duurzame oplossingen beter bereikbaar te maken. Voor iedereen!

 **Sollicitatieprocedure**  

* **Binnen 5 werkdagen reactie**
Of er een volgende stap wordt gezet (en zo ja, welke), weet jij al binnen 5 werkdagen.
* **Het 1e gesprek**
Tijdens onze 1e ontmoeting maken we kennis en bespreken we wat wij voor elkaar kunnen betekenen.
* **Een assessment**
Nieuwsgierig als we zijn, willen wij meteen van alles van je weten. Via je device thuis vul je een online assessment in.
* **Het 2e gesprek**
In een 2e gesprek zetten we de puntjes op de i en beantwoorden we de laatste vragen. Zo weten we beiden waar we aan beginnen.
* **Arbeidsovereenkomst**
Allebei even enthousiast!? Samen met jouw toekomstige manager zet je alle afspraken over het werken bij Achmea op een rij.
company_addresses: We zijn actief in 6 verschillende landen, 5 in Europa en in Australië. Ons hoofdkantoor is in Zeist. In Nederland hebben we met onze merken een landelijke spreiding.
company_description: Wij verzekeren onze klanten voor schade, zorg en inkomen via onze merken. We richten ons op een duurzame toekomst.

title: Market Intelligence Intern
description:
**Who we are:**


Irdeto is the world leader in digital platform cybersecurity, empowering businesses to innovate for a secure, connected future. Building on over 50 years of expertise in security, Irdeto’s services and solutions protect revenue, enable growth and fight cybercrime in video entertainment, video games, and connected industries including transport, health and infrastructure. Irdeto is the security partner dedicated to empowering a secure world where people can connect with confidence.  

  

With teams and offices around the world, Irdeto’s greatest asset is its people - our diversity is celebrated through an inclusive workplace, where everyone has an equal opportunity to drive innovation and contribute to Irdeto's success.

  


**The Role:**

  

  

Our Market Intelligence team provides guidance to Irdeto's strategy toward our 2025 vision to be the leader in the digital platform security market. Internally, we lead the execution of research and analyses in all our verticals and target markets (Video Entertainment, Video Games, Connected Transport) to support strategic decision-making, especially in today’s turbulent business environment.

  


We are a market-driven and innovative team that highly values creativity, hard work and the delivery of quality results for our internal and external customers. Join our Market Intelligence team to explore the world of cybersecurity a cutting-edge technology company, helping to develop of global market and competitive analyses.

  


This exciting full-time internship position starts in **August / September 2024** and runs for six months.

  

  

As our Market Intelligence Intern, you will focus on providing support for the development of global market and competitive analyses.

  

  

Working directly with different internal stakeholders (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Business Development, Product Management) and external third-party research companies, you will support the Market Intelligence Team’s mission to identify market trends, provide early warnings, and continuously support decision making by offering a clear view of the market and its different players. Your learning outcomes will include becoming more knowledgeable in the areas of business strategy, marketing, market research and in the various industries Irdeto is involved in (digital media, video games, automotive). You will be applying your theoretical knowledge and research skills within an international workplace while undertaking real-time global projects which can in turn expand your professional network.

  

  

**Your mission at Irdeto:**


* Perform creative desk-based quantitative and qualitative research on market drivers, market sizing and competitive analysis.
* Gather/cleanse data, build analysis models and run scenarios.
* Write recommendations, draft reports and presentations based on performed research.
* Create business cases under the supervision of the Market Intelligence Team.
* Interact with external analysts and senior management.
* Maintain and update the Market Intelligence portal (an online repository to share market and competitive intelligence material).
* Create in-depth reports based on collection of market and competitive intelligence material.
* Create and maintain detailed profiles for top competitors, including industry benchmarks (by regions and by solutions lines), SWOT analyses, etc.
* Support during business planning process providing insights and analysis for tactical and strategic decision making.

**How can you add value to the team?**


* You are positive, self-motivated, dedicated, initiative-taking, not afraid to take risks, passionate about making a difference, and have a can-do attitude.
* You are currently undertaking, or have recently attained, a degree in Marketing, Business Management, Economics, or another relevant field.
* You have advanced skills in using Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and other common business software.
* You are passionate about working with data and being creative in gathering and analyzing information.
* You have excellent verbal and written English communication and presentation skills.

**What you can expect from us:**


Our people and culture are the heart of our business, and our values of Trust, Accountability, Agility and Innovation inform what we do, and how we work. We believe in investing in our talented employees and promote collaboration, creativity and innovation, health and well-being across our global workforce.  

  

In addition to competitive remuneration and extensive benefits we offer:


* An international and multicultural environment where diversity and inclusivity are celebrated and embraced
* Professional educational opportunities and training program
* Innovation sabbatical
* Volunteer Day
* State of the art office space
* On the job coaching and mentoring
* Flexible work arrangements – via our Work Hard Anywhere policy.
* Some of us run city marathons and even go on snowboarding trips together!
* Casual Friday? Casual every day!
* US$ 500 net for your home office setup after you passed your trial period
* And many additional perks customized to global locations (canteen, fresh fruit, amazing coffee, parking, on-site gym, yoga room to name a few)

Irdeto encourages applications from people with disabilities, as we provide accommodation on request of the candidates that take part in all aspects of the selection processes.

  

  

**Welcome to Irdeto!**

  

  

Irdeto is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Taurus Avenue 105,
2132 LS Hoofddorp,
The Netherlands
company_description: Irdeto’s software security technology and cyber services protect over 5 billion devices and applications for the world’s best-known brands.

title: Development & Asset Manager
description:
JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.
  
  

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.
  
  

#LI-DNI
  
  

**Team Overview:** The specialist European Development and Repurposing platform is a pillar of the pan-European asset management function focused on larger, more complex, and higher-return developments. The Development & repurposing team is a center of technical and commercial expertise that will allow LaSalle Europe expertly create value (and manage risk) via development at scale. The team is also responsible for best practice, alignment, and implementation of our Sustainability/NZC strategy on new assets across our investment strategies. The D&R team is currently composed of 7 Development & Asset Managers. In August 2024, the team is currently managing 14 developments/ refurbishment in 7 different countries representing a portfolio of approximately.
  
€ 5.2 billion of Net Development Value (i.e. circ.20% of current LaSalle European AUM).
  
  

**The main roles of the D&R team are:**  

1. Identifying and implementing value-add & Core plus opportunities: Alternative uses, redevelopments, refurbishments, minimizing irrecoverable.
  
**2. Leading developments across Europe (full development risk):** accountability for the global delivery until practical completion.
  
3. Defining and delivering on leasing strategies including the negotiation of lease contracts, lease regears, renewals, rent reviews
  
**4. Third party relationship management:** E.g.. Development (development manager, project manager, design team, contractors, lawyers, etc.)., managing agents (which includes Property managers and monitoring rent, service charge & insurance), leasing agents, lawyers, and technical professionals.
  
5. Preparing asset level business plans and budget projections.
  
6. Working closely with the acquisition team to advise and validate deals, negotiations, and assumptions.
  
7. Preparing and managing sales alongside with Transaction team.
  
8. Advising and sharing knowledge on local market specificities, practices, and trends with the wider LaSalle business.
  
  

General role description
  
As a Development & Asset Manager, you are jointly responsible for developing and executing real estate projects. You work closely with a senior member of the D&R team to identify new development projects and assess their feasibility. Your tasks include conducting market analyses, assisting in site evaluations and selection, and creating construction and development plans.
  
  

You assist in obtaining building permits, selecting architects, and managing the development process. You collaborate with project teams, contractors, designers, and other professionals to ensure that development progresses according to schedule and budget.
  
  

A crucial part of your role as a Development & Asset Manager is conducting market research to understand demand for real estate products, ESG standards and markets, deriving opportunities for new developments. You need to stay updated on real estate markets, trends, and challenges to gain valuable insights into the development of sustainable real estate projects.
  
  

As a Development & Asset Manager, you will gain extensive knowledge of best-in-class real estate development, project management as well as asset management developing financial analysis and negotiation skills.
  
  

Role and Accountabilities
  
  

**Development:**  

Act as an active team member involved in ongoing projects / developments on the continental Europe development portfolio under the supervision of your line manager.
  
  

Provide support of administrative, contractual, and organizational tasks (such as handling of compliance documents, full cycle handling of RFPs, contract, cost controlling and invoice approvals, etc.)
  
  

Support and documentation of feasibility studies.
  
  

Reporting / recommendation to Fund management team
  
  

Monitor and control costs, schedules, and qualities in various ongoing developments across the European continent.
  
  

Assist in leasing activities (defining leasing strategies, co-ordination of leasing agents and marketing actions, lease negotiations).
  
  

Assist the acquisition team on defining business plans and negotiating development and refurbishment projects (review general assumptions, CAPEX, timing, technical constraints, design & specifications, project team structure, risk analysis, etc.).
  
  

Driving the performance of Third-Party Service providers including implementing RFPs, due diligence, and performance evaluations.
  
  

Contribute proactively to the continuous improvement of the organization and structures within the D&R team (development of standardized processes and templates within in the team across Europe)
  
  

**ESG and NZC:**  

Help the team in researching and finding new ESG ideas and innovative approaches.
  
  

Ensure highest ESG standards within the development in line with the approved budget.
  
  

Ensure compliance with the LaSalle Sustainability policy in asset management. Monitor key reporting under LaSalle’s Four Pillars ESG Framework and LaSalle’s NZC strategy. Enhance the sustainability of assets and achieve agreed sustainability objectives both environmental and social.
  
  

**Asset Management Initiatives:**  

Help implement initiatives identified in the business plan, including marketing strategies, refurbishment/redevelopment projects, consideration of alternative uses and all other opportunities to create and protect value. You will also be required to recommend and justify these initiatives for approval.
  
  

Active participation in sales processes.
  
  

**Innovation and technology:**  

Maintain the in-house data on performance of the specialist properties. Utilise our digital investment and asset management platform (genie). Be curious and have an interest in the latest proptech that drives the operational effectiveness for the assets. Help the team in bringing new ideas and finding innovative ways to enhance sites’ values and create on-site efficiencies on operational assets.
  
  

Goal In this position, you can gain practical experience in best-in-class real estate development/ redevelopment in a multi sector environment (e.g. office, retail, living & hospitality, logistics, alternative,) and further develop your knowledge and skills. With increasing experience and expertise, you will have the opportunity to advance your career as a fully-fledged and completely independent professional at LaSalle.
  
  

**Required Qualifications & Experience:**  

A master’s degree in real estate management, civil engineering, architecture, business school or a related field.
  
  

Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in the asset management real estate industry with a strong technical background and ideally first experience in managing asset development / redevelopment.
  
  

Full professional English proficiency.
  
  

German language skills (at least B1 level)
  
  

Knowledge of European continental market practices (property management, leasing, development, sales, regulations).
  
  

Highly developed verbal and written communication skills + strong negotiating skills.
  
  

Adaptable team player with the ability to operate autonomously when needed in a high-pressure environment.
  
  

Strong numeracy, financial and computer skills including MS Excel and an ability to understand key performance drivers.
  
  

Strong interpersonal skills, both a verbal and written format.
  
  

Ability to work collaboratively with other internal teams including portfolio/fund teams and analysts, finance, strategy, and client services.
  
  

Excellent multi-tasking skills and ability to work on a variety of projects simultaneously.
  
  

Proactive, able to bring new ideas.
  
  

Rigorous and taste for details.
  
  

Able to challenge, innovate and willing to share views openly.
  
  

Knowledge of the impact of sustainability on the property industry.
  
  

Willingness to travel
  
  

LaSalle is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applications from all sections of the community.
  
If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!
  
  

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:
  
  

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.
  
  

About JLL –
  
  

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.
  
  

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.
  
  

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.
company_description: We’re JLL— a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We help organizations around the world achieve their business ambitions.

title: Managing Consultant – Data Science & AI
description:
### **Job Title**


Managing Consultant – Data Science & AI### **Job Description**

**In this role, you have the opportunity to**


work as the Managing Consultant in the Philips Data Science & AI Engineering team which is part of the Innovation & Strategy team in Eindhoven, The Netherlands.

  

Your challenge is to lead a team of 20 consultants and to drive, initiate and generate profitable turnover through projects to support Philips businesses and our customers in the Data Science & AI domain. You know the various Data Science & AI capabilities inside out as well as areas of digitization and analytics providing a future holistic view.


You provide state of the art knowledge and advice to senior leaders within the various Philips businesses and functions, and our customers on:

* Data & AI Advisory and Solution engineering
* Data driven problem solving
* Human centric innovation


As Managing Consultant, you harness the power of DS&AI with our tailored advisory services and solutions. Using your business, domain, process and enterprise data knowledge, together with customer you elaborate on their business challenge, resulting in a clear Data & AI solution proposal, including plan of approach, support and coaching. Also, you orchestrate and guide the implementation of transformative data concepts and solutions, generating the insights required by the business to address their specific challenges.


You pro-actively co-operate in defining and determining the department strategy and directions and actively provide input as well as participating in the definition of the competence area strategy and organizational strategy.


Together with 140 DS&AI specialists in our team apply statistical, ML, DL and GenAI methods to analyse domain & customer specific issues in terms of product, process or service quality, time-to-market, cost and workflow optimization.

**You are responsible for**

* Partnering with clients to define and deliver on digital transformation to achieve rapid improvements in customer experience, innovation, revenue, quality, lead time, and costs
* Team and people leadership, i.e., lead and manage a team of consultant's data analysts and behavioural scientists
* Project leadership including plan and budget; organize and execute activities in projects, guarding project results (both budget and customer satisfaction); implementing and applying Ways of Working in teams to facilitate in-project learning
* Work as advisor, or lead a team of Data Science & AI experts and client team members
* Actively leveraging your existing network, develop and maintain senior management level clients, business development and acquisition of future assignments
* Spot trends in industries and combine these with new competences to create new or improve service propositions and portfolio
* Foresee developments in your competence area and develop new competences yourself and with colleagues

**You are a part of**


You’ll be part of the Innovation & Strategy Data Science & AI Engineering team, a team of around 140 scientists, project managers and consultants who have decades of experience in supporting customers both inside and outside Philips and will support you in terms of proven methodologies and approaches and whose expertise and resources you will leverage in the projects you will engage on.


You will report directly into the Data Science & AI Engineering leader based in the Netherlands.


Finally, this position is part of the Data & AI Consulting practice within I&S which consists of approximately 20 seasoned consultants that are chartered to support BU and Functional leaders in solving complex challenges, thereby improving the productivity and quality of our business. We work with our clients on key aspects for success, namely strategy, road mapping, architecture, process improvement, and new product introductions.

**To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience**

* Master’s degree in a technical or scientific discipline
* 10+ years of experience of which 7+ years working in consulting in healthcare, MedTech, innovation or related field (required)
* Strong leadership experience with a track record of leading direct reports
* Experience in several Data Science and AI capabilities
* Project and Program Management
* Experience in or strong desire to lead business development efforts.
* Self-propelling personality with strong consulting and interpersonal skills with the ability to gain trust, influence, persuade, and build strong relationships
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and effectively with people at all levels in an organization
* Customer oriented mindset, connecting easily to your clients and stakeholders through strong and compelling communication.


Ability to communicate effectively in English  

  

**About Philips**  

We are a health technology company. We built our entire company around the belief that every human matters, and we won't stop until everybody everywhere has access to the quality healthcare that we all deserve. Do the work of your life to help the lives of others.  

* Learn more about our business.
* Discover our rich and exciting history.
* Learn more about our purpose.

  

If you’re interested in this role and have many, but not all, of the experiences needed, we encourage you to apply. You may still be the right candidate for this or other opportunities at Philips. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion here.
#LI-EU
company_description: For more than 130 years, we have been creating technologies and innovations that improve people's lives, support healthcare practitioners, and enable better outcomes for everyone.

title: Master Data & BI Analyst (m/f/d)
description:
Are you a dynamic professional with a knack for data and business intelligence? Join our team as a Master Data & BI Analyst! In this hybrid role, you'll be the linchpin for master data management and business intelligence solutions across the EMEA region. Working closely with our Reporting Director, you'll ensure our multi-ERP environment runs smoothly and contribute to the development of innovative solutions that drive growth.

  

* Own and manage the master data feeding into our Power BI environment, including SKU data, product and segment hierarchies, product cost assignments, and salesperson targets.


* Monitor and enforce the accuracy and consistency of master data inputs into the reporting environment, ensuring high-quality data for decision-making.


* Actively participate in the development of Power BI reports as part of the EMEA region BI Roadmap, enhancing our reporting capabilities.


* Document core processes, especially those that are enhanced or newly introduced, ensuring clarity and continuity in our data management practices.


* Collaborate with Signode IT, business stakeholders, and external resources to ensure alignment and support for reporting initiatives.
* Strong skills in Office 365 (especially MS Excel), basic SQL/SSIS, and super-user proficiency in major BI tools like Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
* Proven experience managing master data within an ERP and/or BI environment, either manually or via third-party tools.
* Diploma or degree in IT/Informatics, Business Administration, or Finance, with several years of relevant experience.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills in English, capable of conveying complex data concepts to diverse audiences; able to work independently with a proactive approach to collaboration.
* Inquisitive and willing to learn about various business functions; demonstrates agility, versatility, and flexibility in adapting to new challenges and improving partially structured environments.
company_description: Signode is a leading global manufacturer of transit packaging and automation solutions with over $2B in revenue, 80+ manufacturing facilities across 6 continents, and over 7000 employees worldwide.

title: Data engineer
description:
Datafundamenten & Analytics (DF&A) is op zoek naar een Data Engineer (schaal 12) binnen de Agile Release Train (ART) Beslissingsondersteuning (BO).  



  

  

  

**Dit doe je bij de Belastingdienst**  

Voor een optimale data-analyse is een sterk fundament qua data nodig. In jouw rol van Data Engineer zorg je ervoor dat deze programmatuur robuust, beheersbaar en productierijp wordt opgeleverd. Hiervoor stel je kwaliteitsrequirements op. In de pre-productiefase zie jij erop toe dat de gebruikte programmatuur aan alle gestelde eisen en standaarden voldoet, waarvoor je gebruik maakt van verschillende tools en platformen, zoals SAS en Teradata.


Wat doe je verder? Samen met de ETL-specialisten los je productie-issues op. Je bent sparringpartner voor functioneel beheerders van de afnemende producten als het gaat om de exploitatie van de producten en je neemt regelmatig deel aan projecten voor productontwikkeling, bijvoorbeeld van datafundamenten of risicomodellen.


Datafundamenten & analytics is volop in ontwikkeling en daarin speel jij een belangrijke rol. Met jouw frisse kijk, energieke persoonlijkheid en verrassende ideeën help je onze organisatie verder vooruit. Maar daarnaast krijg je ook de kans om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen, bijvoorbeeld via een 3-dagenchallenge. En dankzij onze eigen DF&A Academy kun je je kennis flink verbreden. Niet alleen op het gebied van data, maar op allerlei interessante thema’s, zoals privacy, nieuwe communicatietools en prestatietechnieken.  



  

  

**Een bijzondere baan, omdat...**  

* Je een waarde kan bijdragen die telt.
* Kansen voor zelfontwikkeling.

Komt te werken op een afdeling die in beweging is.  
* 
  

  

“*Samen met de data scientists en business analisten ontwikkel ik risicomodellen. En op het moment dat we deze in productie nemen, neem ik mijn verantwoordelijkheid. Ik zorg ervoor dat dit op een gestructureerde*  

*manier gebeurt, omdat ik incidenten liever voorkom dan oplos.*” Thijs, data engineer

 **Wanneer past deze baan bij je?**  

* Je hebt minimaal wo werk- en denkniveau
* Je hebt bij voorkeur kennis van SAS DI-studio en/of Teradata.
* Je hebt minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als ETL specialist of Data Engineer.
* Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met programmeren en kennis van SQL.
* Je spreekt en schrijft Nederlands.
  

**Jouw competenties**  


Plannen en organiseren
Analyseren
Samenwerken
Netwerken
Resultaatgerichtheid  

**De afdeling -** ***Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics***  

De Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics (DF&A) werkt voor directies van de Belastingdienst die belast zijn met de fiscale behandeling van burgers en bedrijven én voor bedrijfsvoering. DF&A levert signaalmodellen en informatiedashboards die zijn gebaseerd op de analyse van ‘big data’ en die de organisatie inzicht geven in de mogelijkheden om werkzaamheden slimmer en beter uit te voeren. Zo kunnen op informatie-gestuurde wijze keuzes worden gemaakt in bijvoorbeeld handhavingsstrategieën, behandeladviezen en procesinrichtingen.  

De signaalmodellen en dashboards worden gebouwd door gebruik te maken van innovatieve IT-ontwikkelingen en het koppelen van zeer divers aangeleverde data. DF&A maakt hiervoor gebruik van een zelfontwikkelde methodiek om data op te bouwen tot datafundamenten, die de basis zijn voor de producten.

 **De organisatie**  

Belastingdienst  

Bij de Belastingdienst werken ongeveer 25.000 mensen verspreid over het hele land aan een financieel gezond Nederland. Dit doen we door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen en premies volksverzekeringen te heffen, te innen en te controleren en fraude op te sporen. De Belastingdienst maakt het burgers en bedrijven zo gemakkelijk mogelijk om verplichtingen na te kunnen komen en gebruik te kunnen maken van rechten. Dat gebeurt met passende dienstverlening, door massale processen juist en tijdig uit te voeren én door adequaat toezicht uit te oefenen. De Belastingdienst is sterk in ontwikkeling en heeft de ambitie om de beste Belastingdienst voor Nederland te zijn met focus op fiscale taken en vakmanschap. Lees meer over de Belastingdienst op: https://over-ons.belastingdienst.nl

 **Bijzonderheden**  

We ontvangen je brief en cv graag in een Word- of PDF-bestand. Neem in de bestandsnaam jouw voor- en achternaam op. Als je een beroep doet op een voorrangspositie, stuur dan ook een kopie van die kennisgeving mee.


Onze selectieprocedure voor deze functie ziet er als volgt uit:

* Allereerst wordt beoordeeld of een voorrangskandidaat binnen de Rijksoverheid in aanmerking komt voor deze functie.
* Daarna wordt beoordeeld of jouw cv en motivatiebrief voldoen aan de gestelde functie-eisen. We streven ernaar jouw sollicitatie binnen twee weken te beoordelen, indien geschikt nodigen we je uit voor een gesprek.

Onderaan deze vacature vind je meer uitleg over de stappen die je doorloopt in de sollicitatieprocedure.


De voorkeur gaat uit naar kandidaten die het meest aansluiten bij het opgestelde profiel. Dit heeft betrekking op zowel de genoemde kennis en werkervaring als op het opleidingsniveau. Vermeld deze daarom duidelijk in je cv.


De Belastingdienst zet zich in voor de banenafspraak: zoveel mogelijk banen realiseren voor mensen met een arbeidsbeperking. Val jij in deze doelgroep? Wij zullen je ondersteunen zodat je optimaal kunt functioneren, en daarmee jouw bijdrage aan Nederland kunt leveren. Of het nu gaat om aanpassingen op je werkplek, bepaalde voorzieningen in het vervoer of bijvoorbeeld vergoedingen van het UWV: samen met jou, je leidinggevende én een jobcoach gaan wij kijken naar jouw kwaliteiten en mogelijkheden om een passend werkpakket uit te voeren. Wil jij weten of je hierbij hoort en wat dit exact betekent voor jou? Lees hier meer.


Een (online) voorselectietest en/of een assessment kan deel uit maken van de sollicitatieprocedure, evenals het maken van een casus, het opvragen van referenties en (online) screening, bijvoorbeeld via databanken, (zoekmachines) en sociale netwerken.


Jouw sollicitatie wordt alleen in behandeling genomen als je met de sollicitatie-button reageert en je cv en motivatiebrief zijn bijgesloten. Na sluitingsdatum is het niet meer mogelijk om je sollicitatie in behandeling te nemen. Houd er rekening mee dat het solliciteren technische problemen met zich mee kan brengen. Wacht hiermee dus niet tot het laatste moment.


Wanneer je solliciteert op een functie maak je eenmalig een account aan. Met je account kan je de status van je sollicitatie inzien.
company_description: De Belastingdienst is 24 uur per dag, 7 dagen per week in bedrijf. We werken aan een financieel gezond Nederland door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen te heffen, te innen en toezicht uit te oefenen.

title: Logistics Synchronization Program Manager
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, or Business, or equivalent practical experience.
* 2 years of experience in Supply Chain, Logistics, Operations, or Planning.
* Experience leading cross-functional projects.
* Experience with data analysis and SQL.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Master's degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, or Business.
* Experience identifying issues in processes, creating solutions, and working with cross-functional teams to drive these changes.
* Advanced proficiency in SQL.
* Familiarity with reading and sharing forecast in an operational environment.
* Familiarity with BlueYonder TMS.

**About the job**
-----------------


A problem isn’t truly solved until it’s solved for all. That’s why Googlers build products that help create opportunities for everyone, whether down the street or across the globe. As a Program Manager at Google, you’ll lead complex, multi-disciplinary projects from start to finish — working with stakeholders to plan requirements, manage project schedules, identify risks, and communicate clearly with cross-functional partners across the company. Your projects will often span offices, time zones, and hemispheres. It's your job to coordinate the players and keep them up to date on progress and deadlines.  

  

Our goal is to build a Google that looks like the world around us — and we want Googlers to stay and grow when they join us. As part of our efforts to build a Google for everyone, we build diversity, equity, and inclusion into our work and we aim to cultivate a sense of belonging throughout the company.



Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Partner with teams across the organization to align delivery dates, optimize processes, and drive complete network improvements that reduce touches and ensure smooth execution of logistics operations.
* Perform ongoing and ad hoc TMS activities, including troubleshooting, configuration, carrier on-boarding, and data-driven analysis for operational efficiency.
* Review short-term forecasts and proactively identify and address capacity risks, develop mitigation plans, and communicate potential impacts to stakeholders.
* Leverage data analytics to identify opportunities for operational efficiency, performance improvement (OTIF), and cost savings.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.
company_description: Our mission is to organize the world’s information and make it universally accessible and useful.

title: Key Account Manager
description:
**Effectory’s mission is to help our customers build meaningful organisations with the voice of** **every** **employee. Our foothold in the Western European markets is growing and our survey solutions are being used by employees, teams and companies in 100+ countries globally. We are working in a SaaS model and service many customers to achieve impact in the working world.**

  

To achieve further growth we need you, because managing long-lasting relationships with key clients is your expertise. Right? We’re looking for a Key Account Manager to join our international team in Amsterdam. In this role you are accountable for retaining our key accounts and supporting the expanding use of our platforms. You are energized by direct contact with our key customers and helping them by pro-actively monitoring their customer journeys. You are a trusted advisor and go-to person for our customers’ needs.

  

In collaboration with the customer success teams you help our valued clients to solve their problems, realize their business goals, and achieve success in projects by delivering upon promise.  



  

  

Do you recognize yourself in these qualities?


* You have **at least 2 years** of work experience in an international (SaaS) environment as an account manager, account executive and/or customer success manager.
* You can spot commercial opportunities and have enough experience/confidence to close the deal.
* You build and maintain trusted relationships with your clients and you're able to manage client expectations.
* With your experience you build empathy to be the link between high-demanding clients and our internal operational teams.
* You work from an alignment of contractual arrangements, and understand that we need punctual admin for accurate data and forecasting.
* You enjoy being the linking pin between different teams to solve complex requests from customers, for example customer success, tech development, legal and finance.
* You are completely fluent in Dutch and English (German would be a plus)

  


**THIS IS US**



Effectory is Europe’s leading employee feedback solution. With our platform, HR and management can collect employee feedback throughout the employee journey. This feedback is transformed into people analytics that informs strategies to boost productivity, engagement and retention. Built on 25 years’ experience, our 250 specialists in Amsterdam and Munich support more than 1,200 organizations in 110 countries. Now more than ever, HR is an integral part of business strategy, which is why our feedback solution is tailor-made for strategic HR.

 **Effectory’s mission**



We are dedicated to improving the working world by giving employees a voice and making sure their feedback has an impact. Our experts work with HR teams and managers around the world, using employee feedback to overcome some of their biggest people-oriented challenges. From software engineers to HR specialists, every day Effectory’s people work to improve the working world, and we are looking for talented individuals who also want to be part of this mission.

 **THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER**


* Competitive salary (range for this position is around: € 41.750 - 60.000 gross a year, depending on your experience).
* Bonus scheme up to 6 months of salary.
* 25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options
* A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues
* A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities, and also organize yearly summer and winter schools
* A senior sales team which will help you develop into a true sales professional
* Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands and/or Germany)
* Budget to set up your home office
* Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you
* Annual events, such as our Winter party, Summer party & the legendary Big Day
* Additional monthly compensation for working from home
* The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical
* You get your birthday off work, and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice

  

***Please send in your application no later than Monday the 19******th*** ***of August! We will follow-up from 20-08 onwards.***

 **THIS IS HOW IT WORKS**


1. *You want this job*: submit your application via the link below


2. *We are intrigued*: join a phone call to further introduce yourself and ask questions


3. *We all think it went well*: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better


4. *We like each other even more*: you meet potential team members and get a bit of a pleasant grilling


5. *We want to see you in action:* you complete a case/assessment


6. *The final hurdle*: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!

  


Hybrid

title: ICT Engineer
description:
Functieomschrijving
-------------------


  
*Wordt de Koninklijke Luchtmacht jouw basis?*  

  

**ICT-engineer**  

  

Ben jij nieuwsgierig naar de dynamische wereld van de Koninklijke Luchtmacht? Als burgermedewerker op de vliegbasis Woensdrecht werk je nauw samen met beroepsmilitairen. Je draagt met jouw eigen specialisatie bij aan de vrede en veiligheid.  

  

**Jouw rol als burgermedewerker bij de Koninklijke Luchtmacht**  

Binnen de afdeling Business Information & Analytics (BIA) zijn wij voor het project Horus op zoek naar 2 enthousiaste en proactieve ICT-engineers die het projectteam compleet maken en het leuk vinden om nieuwe paden te betreden. Het project wordt aangestuurd door 2 ervaren projectleiders en beheerd vanuit het Air Support Command (ASC) op de vliegbasis Woensdrecht.  

  

Eén van de twee beoogde ICT-engineers richt zich op de data-infrastructuur en draagt medeverantwoordelijkheid voor het ontwerpen en bouwen van de IT-infrastructuur. Hierbij speel je een cruciale rol bij het waarborgen van systeembetrouwbaarheid en veiligheid. De andere medewerker concentreert zich op het ontwerpen van producten, zoals sensormodules, die bedrijfsprocessen binnen het ASC verbeteren en optimaliseren. Hierbij ligt de nadruk op het genereren en analyseren van data om de bedrijfsvoering van het ASC te optimaliseren.  

  

Je speelt een cruciale rol in het vormgeven van dit unieke project en het waarborgen van de toekomstige integratie ervan binnen de bedrijfsvoering van het ASC. Je levert ondersteuning aan het project Horus door het leveren van overzichten, analyses, toelichtingen en prognoses op basis van de verzamelde gegevens en informatie. Verder houd je je bezig met het maken van concrete (inhoudelijke) deelproducten. Ook het leveren van procesmatige en procedurele ondersteuning van besluitvorming door mee te werken aan het opzetten van sensornetwerken met als doel om datagedreven besluitvorming mogelijk te maken is onderdeel van het takenpakket. Bovendien ben je verantwoordelijk voor het bijdragen aan het opzetten en optimaliseren van sensornetwerken alsmede het verwerken van de daaruit voortvloeiende data om de bedrijfsvoering te optimaliseren.  

  

Daarbij lever je een bijdrage aan het innovatieproces door:  

  

* het beheren van en meewerken aan innovatieprojecten en experimenten.
* het faciliteren, ondersteunen en het inregelen van randvoorwaarden voor verbeter- en innovatieprojecten.
* het verrichten van administratieve activiteiten, waaronder het opzetten c.q. bijhouden van een project/kennis database.
* het ordenen en vastleggen van kennis die tijdens het innovatieproces wordt opgedaan.

  
Functie-eisen
-------------


  
**Dit neem je mee naar de Koninklijke Luchtmacht**  

Het grootste goed dat je meeneemt naar de Koninklijke Luchtmacht is motivatie en enthousiasme. Toch is het ook belangrijk dat je de juiste papieren, ervaring en kennis hebt wanneer je bij ons aan de slag gaat. Dit is wat we van jou vragen:


* Je beschikt over mbo- of hbo-werk- en -denkniveau en hebt affiniteit met bedrijfsanalyses en technologie.
* Je hebt een goede mondelinge en schriftelijke beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.
* Je bezit sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, bent klantgericht, omgevingsgericht en leergierig. Je kunt goed zelfstanding werken en bent sterk in samenwerken. Je hebt verantwoordelijkheidsbesef en het vermogen om te plannen en organiseren.

  
Arbeidsvoorwaarden
------------------


  
* Salarisniveau schaal 8
* Maandsalaris Min €3.275 – Max. €4.396 (bruto)
* Dienstverband Tijdelijke aanstelling met uitzicht op vaste aanstelling
* Contractduur Arbeidsovereenkomst voor bepaalde tijd met uitzicht op vaste aanstelling
* Minimaal aantal uren per week 38
* Maximaal aantal uren per week 40

  
Overige arbeidsvoorwaarden
--------------------------


  
**Onze beloning voor jou**  

Hard werken mag beloond worden. Daarom zorgen we voor een passend salaris voor jou. Vakantiegeld, een eindejaarsuitkering, betaald ouderschapsverlof, een vergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer en uitgebreide studiemogelijkheden behoren ook tot de voordelen.


  
**Meer over jouw toekomstige afdeling**
---------------------------------------


**Welkom op Vliegbasis Woensdrecht bij Project Horus!**  

Vliegbasis Woensdrecht is dé ondersteuningsvliegbasis van de Luchtmacht. Hier vind je de Koninklijke Militaire School Luchtmacht (KMSL) en het Logistiek Centrum Woensdrecht (LCW). Samen zorgen de KMSL en het LCW voor opleidingen, meteorologische ondersteuning, logistiek en onderhoud – voor de Luchtmacht én de rest van Defensie.



Project Horus is een initiatief dat de technologieën en processen van het Air Support Command (ASC) optimaliseert. Project Horus implementeert innovaties uit de sensoren, data-analyse, AI/ML, digitale tweelingen en IT-industrieën. Het doel is om onderhoudsconcepten voor luchtvaartuigonderhoudsmateriaal te verbeteren door een sensornetwerk op te zetten binnen het ASC waardoor in de toekomst Condition Based en Predictive Maintenance onderhoudstechnieken mogelijk worden gemaakt. Door sensordata te analyseren en visualiseren streeft Project Horus ernaar waardevolle inzichten te bieden voor optimale prestaties en kostenverlaging door Data-Driven Decision-Making. Project Horus is een innovatief project dat loopt van 2024 tot eind 2027.



**Koninklijke Luchtmacht**
--------------------------



De Koninklijke Luchtmacht is een modern en technologisch krijgsmachtdeel dat wereldwijd actief is. De luchtmacht ondersteunt bestrijding van internationale onrust en biedt hulp bij rampen. In Nederland zorgt ze voor veiligheid vanuit de lucht. Hiervoor beschikt het krijgsmachtdeel over hooggekwalificeerd personeel, vliegtuigen, helikopters en andere wapensystemen.



Koninklijke Luchtmacht
**Stel gerust je vraag**
------------------------


### **Meer informatie over deze vacature**


### **Meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure**

title: Business Analyst Global
description:
Your role
  
  

Interfood is looking for a Business Analyst to join the Global IT team to develop, improve, promote and maintain its data products.
  
  

**As a new Business Analyst, you:**  

Add value by creating meaningful insights from a wide variety of data sources by reporting, visualizing and storytelling.
  
Add value to various disciplines like supply chain, finance, quality, commerce, or sustainability.
  
Are the first point of contact towards the business teams for data products.
  
Are responsible for the day-to-day management of our data products.
  
Act as a catalyst for change by training your stakeholders and supporting global innovation projects.
  
Identify and develop improvement opportunities and ensure global connection between different business teams.
  
Ensure the data products are managed to high quality standards.
  
Ensure your personal growth and development through (external) courses and trainings.
  
  

**Your activities will be divided like:**  

Project based activities 60%
  
Development new global reporting 20%
  
Key user role on global data products 15%
  
Alignment with end users 10%
  
Testing/improving products 5%
  
Team up with external partners 5%
  
Data management (accuracy, uploaded in time, completeness) 5%
  
Community development current data champions, building community, training, sharing dashboarding globally 30%
  
Personal growth and development 10%
  
Your profile
  
At least Bachelor (Bsc) or equivalent with emphasis in data, finance, supply chain management, or economics.
  
1-3 years of (international) experience in business/data analytics.
  
Solid understanding of business intelligence tools, including Tableau, and SQL is a plus.
  
Team player and effective communicator that can work closely together with other teams.
  
Creative problem solver that is always looking for the next idea that can piece the puzzle together.
  
Ability to adapt fast in a rapidly changing environment.
  
Take ownership of your analyses and feel responsible for joint success.
  
Knowledge of data science, data engineering or data democratization is a plus.
  
A day in the life of a business analyst
  
08:30
  
  

Grab a cup of coffee and catch-up on mails, organize to do's and priorities.
  
  

09:00
  
  

Join the daily stand-up with your department, and project partners, to discuss the priorities for the day.
  
  

09:30
  
  

Follow-up with our engineers on the actions from the stand-up. Define the actions, ownership and identify potential bottlenecks.
  
  

10:00
  
  

Time to work on some testing with the business such that our team has the right feedback.
  
  

11:00
  
  

Meet-up with the Interfood traders to discuss some of the latest reports you are improving.
  
  

12:00
  
  

A well-deserved lunch in our restaurant, followed by a relaxing stroll through nature.
  
  

13:00
  
  

Escalation call with several stakeholders on an urgent problem in one of the tools.
  
  

13:15
  
  

Moment of peace, where you can do necessary administration, check reports, respond to emails and talk with direct colleagues to ensure full integration.
  
  

15:00
  
  

Team meeting with the full department. In this meeting you discuss your projects and listen to the projects of your colleagues. As a team you discuss and overcome challenges.
  
  

15:45
  
  

Meeting with your direct manager to discuss the priorities and personal development plan.
  
  

17:00
  
  

What a day, time for some exercise. Luckily, you signed up in time for a “Bootcamp Session” in the gym (in the basement), which will be led by Interfood’s professional personal trainer.
  
  

17:30
  
  

Time to go home, and pack your bags, because tomorrow morning you will fly to Singapore to meet the business team, together with another colleague. Don’t forget your passport!
  
  

Your colleagues
  
Iris Wijers
  
Data Analyst & Community Manager
  
  

Why Interfood?
  
Interfood is a fantastic company for both personal and professional growth. When I started fresh out of college, I never imagined I would become a community manager traveling to Singapore, Uruguay, and Miami, or speaking about my experiences at events. Interfood provides the space to develop and pursue the skills you're passionate about. Plus, we're a really fun team to work with, if I say so myself.
  
  

What do you expect from your new colleague?
  
**My job involves many elements:** building reports in Tableau, managing our Tableau server, overseeing projects, working on ETL with our engineers, and more. I expect a new colleague to identify their areas of interest and become a sparring partner in those areas—whether it's one or all of them. I look forward to taking you along on this journey and learning from you as well.
  
  

Chandrayee Majumder
  
Senior Data Engineer
  
  

Why Interfood?
  
Interfood is a great place to work; it truly invests in the well-being and development of its employees. When I joined, I never imagined the opportunities I'd have to grow professionally and personally, including working on innovative data projects. Interfood supports your passions and ensures a balanced, fulfilling work environment. Plus, the Global IT team is amazing to work with, full of supportive and talented colleagues.
  
  

What do you expect from your new colleague?
  
This role of business analyst involves close interaction with the data engineering team, serving as the main go-to person for any business-related questions and acting as a bridge between technical solutions and business problem statements. I expect our new business analyst to bring strong analytical skills, problem-solving abilities, and excellent communication. Collaboration is key, as he/she will work closely with diverse teams across regions. Additionally, we value a dynamic and fun employee who can contribute positively to our team's culture.
  
  

Our offer
  
Dynamic work environment right in the heart of a fast-changing commodity trader.
  
Young and diverse team within a great atmosphere.
  
Exciting role between business and IT.
  
International career opportunities.
  
Participate in fun team activities.
  
40 hour work week, 25 holidays.
  
Attractive compensation and benefits package.
  
Reporting to the Global Data & Analytics Manager.
  
We value your personal development and have a strategic focus on our learning program.
  
Travel internationally.
  
About Interfood
  
  

Do you like to work for an international company? Do you value professionality and quality? Are you comfortable in a dynamic environment? But on the other hand looking for cooperation in a close and informal team? Then Interfood is the ideal employer for you.
  
  

The Interfood Group is a leading global dairy trading company (milk powders, butter, cheese, dairy blends etc.). The Group consists of 14 offices in all continents with more than 350 employees. Our constant strive for optimal quality, up-to-date knowledge and a profound focus on service, enables Interfood to create the difference for its robust network of both clients and suppliers.
  
  

Interfood keeps on growing and developing by its proactive market approach.
  
  

We stimulate personal development and initiatives from our employees. Interfood, originally a family-based company, proves that global professionalism can still be combined with a unique personal company culture, in which we focus on following values: Teamwork, Commitment, Continuous Improvement, Professionalism & Responsible Leadership. All contributing to our purpose: Together for better.
  
  

Will you become our new team member?

title: Data Engineer II - SmartBenefits Foundations
description:
Role Description:

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world. **Role Description**:
This role is based in Amsterdam. The scope of the Accommodation (Tech) team touches all the products that relate to Accommodations, from the platform to the end-user and everything in between. This is the largest and fastest growing department at Booking.com. You will have a chance to help one of the largest travel websites in the world!
In the Customer Data area, our mission is to create a competitive advantage by building a clear understanding of our travelers and partners through data. One of the foundational tasks to deliver this is to build a source of truth in the company for Trips Data, both at a transactional and Customer level. Some main projects involve connecting data from different products, bringing the connected trip to life in our databases, metrics and insights, crafting a data warehouse, applying use cases of this data to the business such as cross-selling opportunities and many more to come.  

As a Data Engineer, you will be working with partners throughout the company to ensure we have high-quality data to power our business in all departments. Decisions for every part of our business - from the front end experience to performance marketing to partner products - are driven by petabytes of our data via MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc. Your challenge will be to make sure we can apply our petabyte-scale data even more effectively to support business decisions and improve our products. **Key Job Responsibilities and Duties**
As a Data Engineer, you will be in charge of the development, performance, quality, and scaling of our data pipelines, focusing especially on data quality. You will work independently and will also be responsible for making technical decisions within a team.* Rapidly developing next-generation scalable, flexible, and high-performance data pipelines.
* Solving issues with data and data pipelines, prioritizing based on customer impact.
* End-to-end ownership of data quality in our core datasets and data pipelines.
* Experimenting with new tools and technologies to meet business requirements regarding performance, scaling, and data quality.
* Providing tools that improve Data Quality company-wide.
* Providing self-organizing tools that help the analytics community discover data, assess quality, explore usage, and find peers with relevant expertise.
* Acting as an intermediary for problems, with both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Supplying to a high scale, complex, world renowned product and seeing real-time impact of your work on millions of travelers worldwide
* Promote and drive impactful and innovative engineering solutions
* Technical, behavioral and interpersonal competence advancement via on-the-job opportunities, experimental projects, hackathons, conferences, and active community participation

 **Role Qualifications and Requirements*** You have more than +3 years of professional experience as a Software Developer/Data Engineer and hold a degree in a quantitative field
* You have built production data pipelines in the cloud, setting up data-lake and server-less solutions; ‌you have hands-on experience with schema design and data modeling.
* You have experience designing systems E2E and knowledge of basic concepts (lb, db, caching, NoSQL, etc)
* Proven knowledge of Python is required, Java/Scala will be a plus
* Knowledge of Hadoop, Hive, Sqoop, MySQL imports, Oozie, Spark, CDC, Kafka, Cassandra, Airflow.
* Experience with Data Warehousing and ETL/ELT pipelines
* You are driven by petabytes of our data via MySQL, Hadoop, Cassandra, etc
* Excellent communication skills - verbal and written

 **Benefits & Perks****: Global Impact, Personal Relevance*** Annual paid time off and generous paid leave scheme including: parental (22-weeks paid leave), grandparent, bereavement, and care leave
* Hybrid working including flexible working arrangements, working from home furniture and ergonomic support, and up to 20 days per year working from abroad (home country)
* A beautiful sustainable HQ Campus in Amsterdam, that offers on-site meals, coffee, and snacks, multi-faith and breastfeeding rooms at the office\*
* Commuting allowance and bike reimbursement scheme
* Discounts & Wallet credits to spend on our products, upgrade to Booking.com Genius Level 3, and friends & family Booking.com discount vouchers
* Free access to online learning platforms, development and mentorship programs
* Global Employee Assistance Program, free Headspace membership

 **#ThinkInclusion****: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com**
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone.  

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustments to participate in the interview process. Please contact us to request adjustments. **Career Development Opportunities*** Bi-annual performance conversations, company-wide mentoring program, and internal development opportunities
* Unlimited access to online learning platforms: Udemy, Coursera, LinkedIn learning, O'reilly

 **Application Process*** The interview process entails: an online Coding challenge, a coding interview, a system design interview, and a final behavioral interview
* Full relocation support will be offered for you and your family (if the case) to move to Amsterdam - one of the most cosmopolitan cities in Europe.
company_description: Making it easier for everyone to experience the world.

title: Modern Workplace Engineer
description:
Come join us
  
**Come join us**As a consultant on our Modern Workplace team, you’ll shape, sell and coordinate solutions that address client
challenges. You’ll have an opportunity to focus on areas that stretch across the business—employee experience
strategy and transformation, employee analytics and insights, employee value proposition modernisation,
workforce transformation, culture change and physical workplace design.
As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning and ambitious
growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and
creative, helping us better serve our clients and our communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive
collaborators to lift, mentor and guide you, but to also lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built
for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact
and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look! **Together we do what matters.**
  
Skills and experiences
  
**Skills and experiences*** Previous consulting or advisory experience with strong communication, presentation and facilitation skills
* An understanding of how to collect and generate insight from quantitative and qualitative data
* Partnering with executive level clients, assessing client's goals and objectives and the ability to translate ideas

into strategic and practical solutions
Other desired skills include:
* Application of design thinking principles and methodologies
* Knowledge of ground-breaking technologies (artificial intelligence, 5G, Internet of Things, machine learning,

blockchain)
  
About you
  
**About you**Characteristics that can spell success for this role
* Analytical, curious, agile
* Team player and good communicator
* Problem-solver, patient, quality-driven
* Self-motivating
* Innovative mindset
* Current resident of The Netherlands and fluent Dutch speaker

  
What you'll do
  
* **What you’ll do**
	+ Address client challenges in areas of employee experience strategy and transformation, employee analyticsand insights, employee value proposition modernisation, workforce transformation, culture change and
physical workplace design

	+ Develop employee and team-centric experiences using data-driven insights to drive innovation, productivityimprovement and retention of top talent

	+ Develop and evolve future focused workforce and organisation transformation strategies, propositions andsolutions

	+ Drive cultural and operating model change as part of the transition to a high-performing, employee-centricmodern workplace

	+ Support modern workplace practice leadership on client engagements

  
Enjoy your career
  
**Enjoy your career**Some of the best things about working at Avanade
* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s global alliance partner of the year (14 years in a row), with exceptional

development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you

Find out more about some of our benefits here .
  
A great place to work
  
**A Great Place to Work**As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!  

  

We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page .  

  

Create a future for our people that focuses on
• Expanding your thinking • Experimenting courageously • Learning and pivoting  

  

Inspire greatness in our people by
• Empowering every voice • Encouraging boldness • Celebrating progress  

  

Accelerate the impact of our people by
• Amazing the client • Prioritizing what matters • Acting as one

title: Release Train Engineer (RTE)
location: Alphen aan den Rijn, ZH, NL
description:
#Bethedifference
If making a difference matters to you, then you matter to us.*If you are experienced in working in a software environment and looking for a new challenge,* *you could be the right person to join the Team at Wolters Kluwer’s Enablon.*
A Wolters Kluwer business since 2016, Enablon is the world’s leading Sustainability, EHS and Risk Management software provider. Our mission is to enable the sustainable company and our objectives are to help our clients to operate safely, reduce risks, and thrive.
The company is going now through a change towards being a 360° Risk Management SaaS provider. This implies a technical revamp by implementing modern technologies and focusing on data management and data analytics.
Job Description:
The Release Train Engineer (RTE) facilitates an Agile Release Train (ART) at the Program level and is responsible for program execution of the value stream, assist the team in the delivery of innovative software products, escalating impediments, managing risk, and helping drive continuous improvement for the ART.
RTEs are responsible for facilitating ART events including Planning Increment (PI), PI execution events, tracking of progress, System Demos, and Inspect & Adapt. The RTE ensures mission execution, coaches at the ART and Team levels, and provides guidance in methodologies like Agile, Scrum, DevSecOps, and Kanban.
Responsibilities:
Planning, coordination, and delivery* Leads and serves as the highest authority on the implementation and optimization for the SAFe methodology within the ART
* Ensure the quality and timeliness of deliverables in the ART by managing dependencies and risks
* Manages and optimizes the flow of value within the ART using a variety of tools and methods to ensure strategy and execution are in alignment
* Assist Scrum Masters in the execution of Planning increments (PI’s).
* Ensure backlogs are complete, relevant and in alignment with strategic objectives and follows DoR and DoD standards


Facilitation & coaching* Facilitates and drive ART ceremonies including PI planning, Scrum of Scrums, System Demo’s and Inspect and Adapt sessions.
* Measure and improve ART performance (maturity) through clearly defined metrics Coach and advise leaders, teams and scrum masters in Lean-Agile practices, mindsets and execution
* Coach and support the team in applying the agile way of working (Scrum, KanBan, ScrumBan) that fits best with the type of work they have.


Communication and collaboration* Serve as the primary point of contact for all ART stakeholders. - Communicates progress, status and challenges to stakeholders including senior management and ensures that business strategy and technology strategy are connected.
* Foster collaboration between teams, product management, system architects and services
* Identify and resolve conflicts that impede the ARTs progress


Leadership* Provide a servant leadership style aimed at support and guiding teams and stakeholders
* Performs functional allocation of resources to identified and required tasks and their dependencies Develop and maintain a high level of team morale and cohesion
* Drive an empower the ART to self-organize and self-manage
* Communicates progress, status and challenges to stakeholders including senior management


Requirements:* 5+ years of experience in a Release Train Engineer or similar role within an Agile environment.
* Proven track record in delivery management, with experience leading cross-functional teams.
* Strong understanding of SAFe principles and practices, with a focus on flow metrics
* Technical awareness with good domain knowledge
* Excellent facilitation, coaching, and mentoring skills.
* Proficiency in Agile tools and metrics tracking.
* A understanding of the phases of software delivery (SDLC)
* Ability to motivate teams
* Ability to think beyond day-to-day activities and apply system thinking


Click here to see more about Enablon
Begin your journey to becoming part of Wolters Kluwer Enablon family by clicking the apply button!
Equal Opportunity Employer*Wolters Kluwer and all of its subsidiaries, divisions and customer/business units is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other protected status.*
GDPR
About Us
Wolters Kluwer is a global provider of professional information, software solutions, and services for clinicians, nurses, accountants, lawyers, and tax, finance, audit, risk, compliance, and regulatory sectors.
For 180 years, Wolters Kluwer has been innovating the way professionals and businesses work. Our employees are at the cornerstone of bringing our vision to life.
Our pursuit of excellence coupled with the pride we take in our work, enables our customers to solve their most critical problems. At Wolters Kluwer we encourage you to be your unique self, bring your ideas to life, learn, develop, and thrive. We offer you a world of endless opportunities.
